verses.text: And the ark of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was in the country of the Philistines seven months.
And the Philistines called for the priests and the diviners , saying , What shall we do to the ark of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*? tell us wherewith we shall send it to his place.

And they said , If ye send away the ark of the God of Israel , send it not empty ; but in any wise return him a trespass offering : then ye shall be healed , and it shall be known to you why his hand is not removed from you.

Then said they, What \add shall be\add* the trespass offering which we shall return to him? They answered , Five golden emerods , and five golden mice , \add according to\add* the number of the lords of the Philistines : for one plague \add was\add* on you all, and on your lords.\f + \fr 6.4 \ft you: Heb. them\f*

Wherefore ye shall make images of your emerods , and images of your mice that mar the land ; and ye shall give glory unto the God of Israel : peradventure he will lighten his hand from off you, and from off your gods , and from off your land.

Wherefore then do ye harden your hearts , as the Egyptians and Pharaoh hardened their hearts ? when he had wrought wonderfully among them, did they not let the people go , and they departed ?\f + \fr 6.6 \ft wonderfully: or, reproachfully\f*\f + \fr 6.6 \ft the people: Heb. them\f*
Now therefore make a new cart , and take two milch kine , on which there hath come no yoke , and tie the kine to the cart , and bring their calves home from them :

And take the ark of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and lay it upon the cart ; and put the jewels of gold , which ye return him \add for\add* a trespass offering , in a coffer by the side thereof; and send it away , that it may go.

And see , if it goeth up by the way of his own coast to Beth-shemesh , \add then\add* he hath done us this great evil : but if not, then we shall know that \add it is\add* not his hand \add that\add* smote us; it \add was\add* a chance \add that\add* happened to us.\f + \fr 6.9 \ft he: or, it\f* \p
¶ And the men did so ; and took two milch kine , and tied them to the cart , and shut up their calves at home :
And they laid the ark of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* upon the cart , and the coffer with the mice of gold and the images of their emerods.

And the kine took the straight way to the way of Beth-shemesh , \add and\add* went along the highway , lowing as they went , and turned not aside \add to\add* the right hand or \add to\add* the left ; and the lords of the Philistines went after them unto the border of Beth-shemesh.
And \add they of\add* Beth-shemesh \add were\add* reaping their wheat harvest in the valley : and they lifted up their eyes , and saw the ark , and rejoiced to see \add it\add*.

And the cart came into the field of Joshua , a Beth-shemite , and stood there, where \add there was\add* a great stone : and they clave the wood of the cart , and offered the kine a burnt offering unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

And the Levites took down the ark of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and the coffer that \add was\add* with it, wherein the jewels of gold \add were\add*, and put \add them\add* on the great stone : and the men of Beth-shemesh offered burnt offerings and sacrificed sacrifices the same day unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.
And when the five lords of the Philistines had seen \add it\add*, they returned to Ekron the same day.

And these \add are\add* the golden emerods which the Philistines returned \add for\add* a trespass offering unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; for Ashdod one , for Gaza one , for Askelon one , for Gath one , for Ekron one ;

And the golden mice , \add according to\add* the number of all the cities of the Philistines \add belonging\add* to the five lords , \add both\add* of fenced cities , and of country villages , even unto the great \add stone of\add* Abel , whereon they set down the ark of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: \add which stone remaineth\add* unto this day in the field of Joshua , the Beth-shemite.\f + \fr 6.18 \ft great…: or, great stone\f* \p

¶ And he smote the men of Beth-shemesh , because they had looked into the ark of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, even he smote of the people fifty thousand and threescore and ten men : and the people lamented , because the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* had smitten \add many\add* of the people with a great slaughter.
And the men of Beth-shemesh said , Who is able to stand before this holy \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God ? and to whom shall he go up from us? \p

¶ And they sent messengers to the inhabitants of Kirjath-jearim , saying , The Philistines have brought again the ark of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; come ye down , \add and\add* fetch it up to you.
